node.title: Death of pregnant woman ignites debate about abortion ban in Poland
node.description: The 30-year-old woman went to hospital after her waters broke but she died on the way to the operating theatre, with critics of Poland's near-total abortion ban blaming her death on laws introduced in January.
node.content:
["Protesters turned out in Warsaw and in many other Polish cities Saturday to decry the country's restrictive abortion law, which they say has led to the death of a young mother with a pregnancy that had medical problems.", "The protesters held portraits of the woman, 30-year-old Izabela, who died in hospital in Pszczyna, southern Poland, from septic shock.", "She died in September, but her death just became known in the past week.", "Doctors at the hospital held off terminating her 22-week pregnancy despite the fact that her fetus lacked enough amniotic fluid to survive, according to\u00a0her family's\u00a0lawyer.", "Women's rights activists said\u00a0the woman was a victim of Poland's newly restrictive abortion law, which was introduced in January.", "They said doctors in Poland, a heavily Catholic nation, now wait for a fetus with severe defects to die in the womb rather than perform an abortion.", "Unlawful abortion can carry a sentence of up to eight years in prison.", "
'She went there for help'
", "", "
Protesters in Warsaw rallied a day after the hospital where Izabela died suspended two doctors.(AP: Czarek Sokolowski)
", "Izabela went to hospital in September after her waters broke, her family said. Scans had previously shown numerous defects in the foetus.", "\"The baby weighs 485 grams. For now, thanks to the abortion law, I have to lie down. And there is nothing they can do. They'll wait until it dies or something begins, and if not, I can expect sepsis,\" Izabela said in a text message to her mother, private broadcaster TVN24 reported.", "When a scan showed the foetus was dead, doctors at the hospital in Pszczyna, southern Poland, decided to perform a Caesarean.", "The family's lawyer, Jolanta Budzowska, said Izabela's heart stopped on the way to the operating theatre and she died despite efforts to resuscitate her.", "\"I couldn't believe it, I thought it wasn't true,\" Izabela's mother Barbara told TVN24.", "Ms Budzowska has started legal action over the treatment Izabela received, accusing doctors of malpractice, but she also called the death \"a consequence of the verdict\".", "In a statement on its website, the Pszczyna County Hospital said it shared the pain of all those affected by Izabela's death, especially her family.", "\"It should\u00a0\u2026 be emphasised that all medical decisions were made taking into account the legal provisions and standards of conduct in force in Poland,\" the hospital said.", "On Friday, the hospital said it had suspended two doctors who were on duty at the time of the death.", "
Ruling party\u00a0says laws\u00a0not to blame
", "", "
In Poznan, crowds gathered and held lights aloft, similar to other demonstrations in other cities like\u00a0Gdansk,\u00a0Wroclaw and Bialystok.(Reuters:\u00a0Lukasz Cynalewski/Agencja Wyborcza.pl)
", "When the case came to public attention as a result of a tweet from Ms Budzowska, the hashtag #anijednejwiecej or 'not one more' spread across social media and was taken up by protesters demanding a change to the law.", "They\u00a0gathered before the Constitutional Tribunal that ruled last year that terminating a pregnancy with congenital defects is against Poland's constitution.", "They then marched to the Health Ministry and lit up their mobile phones in memory of the woman who died.", "Protests were also held in Gdansk, Poznan, Wroclaw, Bialystok and in many other cities.", "Before the new restriction, women in Poland could have abortions only in three cases: if the pregnancy resulted from a crime like rape, if the woman's life was at risk, or in the case of irreparable defects of the fetus.", "The last possibility was closed by the tribunal's verdict.", "Those in favour of the new restriction say it's not clear that the restriction led to the woman's death.", "However, Poland's ruling Law and Justice (PiS) party rejects claims that the Constitutional Tribunal ruling was to blame for Izabela's death, attributing it to a mistake by doctors.", "\"When it comes to the life and health of the mother \u2026 if it is in danger, then terminating the pregnancy is possible and the ruling does not change anything,\" Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki said on Friday.", "PiS MP Bartlomiej Wroblewski told Reuters that the case should not be \"instrumentalised and used to limit the right to life, to kill all sick or disabled children\".", "Health Minister Adam Niedzielski said the case was \"difficult\" and needed close analysis.", "He said instructions will be issued to make it clear to obstetricians that a \"woman's safety is a reason to terminate a pregnancy\".", "
Family hopes for changes
", "", "
Protestors outside Poland's Constitutional Tribunal in Warsaw hold portraits of Izabela.(AP: Czarek Sokolowski)
", "But activists say the ruling has made doctors scared to terminate pregnancies \u2014\u00a0even when the mother's life is at risk.", "\"Izabela's case clearly shows that the ruling of the Constitutional Tribunal has had a chilling effect on doctors,\" Urszula Grycuk of the Federation for Women and Family Planning told Reuters.", "\"Even a condition that should not be questioned \u2014 the life and health of the mother \u2014 is not always recognised by doctors because they are afraid.\"", "In Ireland, the death of 31-year-old Savita Halappanavar in 2012 after she was refused a termination provoked a national outpouring of grief credited by many as a catalyst for the liberalisation of abortion laws.", "Ms Budzowska told Reuters that a debate similar to the one that took place in Ireland was underway in Poland.", "\"Both Izabela's family and I personally hope that this case \u2026 will lead to a change in the law in Poland,\" she said.", "Poland's president proposed changing the law last year to make abortions possible in cases where the foetus was not viable.", "Parliament has yet to debate the bill.", "ABC/Wires"]
